title: Font aficionados, I need help
content:
I need real life examples of Trebuchet MS. It’s a web based font, so I don’t know how many examples of it would be in print, if any at all. But anything and everything would be extremely helpful, websites, posters, books, etc.

Thank you.

 [‹ Univers on the web](http://web.archive.org/web/20080422064715/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41814 "Go to previous forum topic") [Appropriate use of the ampersand ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080422064715/http:/www.typophile.com/node/12426 "Go to next forum topic")
author: lookatmeimsam

comments.content: Trebuchet on Flickr: by [its designer Vince Connare](http://web.archive.org/web/20080422064715/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/93279914@N00/415499275/) and [Joe Clark](http://web.archive.org/web/20080422064715/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/joeclark/1413834981/).
I see Meta in Vince’s photo. Where’s the Trebuchet?
Oops, sorry. Didn’t really look at the pictures, just trusted the search. My bad.
It’s kind of a Freudian slip, though. As Trebuchet borrows a few things from Meta.
